discoveredAssets: localhost:2280 - HTTP Service (Go/Daytona) - Port 2280 - Returns 404 on all endpoints
localhost:22222 - Web Terminal Application (xterm.js) - Port 22222 - Public web-based shell access via WebSocket, NO authentication
localhost:22220 - SSH Service (Go SSH-2.0) - Port 22220 - Remote SSH access point

targets.objective: Test web terminal for unauthorized access, WebSocket security, command injection, privilege escalation, and RCE via terminal input. Verify authentication/authorization controls and input validation on terminal commands.
targets.rationale: Critical vulnerability: web-based shell with no authentication detected. Direct remote code execution capability exposed to any network access. Port 22222 is publicly accessible with interactive shell execution capability via browser and WebSocket endpoint.

targets.objective: Test SSH authentication mechanisms for weak credentials, authentication bypass, key management vulnerabilities, and privilege escalation. Verify SSH configuration security (protocol versions, cipher suites, authentication methods).
targets.rationale: Critical remote access point: SSH service running on non-standard port 22220. Part of Daytona sandbox infrastructure, potential for unauthorized remote code execution if credentials are weak or default.

targets.objective: Enumerate for hidden endpoints, API routes, configuration endpoints. Test for information disclosure, debug endpoints, and administrative interfaces. Verify if service is intentionally disabled or has restricted routing.
targets.rationale: HTTP service responding with 404 on all tested common endpoints. May have application-specific routes or be part of internal communication layer within Daytona. Worth thorough enumeration and fuzzing for discovery.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Unauthenticated web-based terminal on port 22222 (http://localhost:22222) - Direct remote code execution capability accessible via browser with NO authentication required
[CRITICAL] WebSocket endpoint at /ws (ws://localhost:22222/ws) - Bidirectional shell communication channel with no apparent authentication or encryption
[CRITICAL] SSH service on non-standard port 22220 (ssh://localhost:22220) - Remote access point, potential for unauthorized access if credentials are weak
[MEDIUM] HTTP service on port 2280 returns 404 on all endpoints - Unclear purpose, appears to be placeholder or internal service with restricted/no routing
[LOW] Service fingerprints: Go-based SSH (SSH-2.0-Go) and Go-based application (Daytona framework) - Potential Go-specific vulnerabilities may apply
